segment.source: How to use contacts and calendar info in your UWP app.
segment.target: How to use contacts and calendar info in your UWP app.

segment.source: Contacts and calendar
segment.target: Contacts and calendar

segment.source: Contacts and calendar
segment.target: Contacts and calendar

segment.source: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive

segment.source: You can let your users access their contacts and appointments so they can share content, email, calendar info, or messages with each other, or whatever functionality you design.
segment.target: You can let your users access their contacts and appointments so they can share content, email, calendar info, or messages with each other, or whatever functionality you design.

segment.source: To see a few different ways in which your app can access contacts and appointments, see these topics:
segment.target: To see a few different ways in which your app can access contacts and appointments, see these topics:

segment.source: Topic
segment.target: Topic

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Select contacts
segment.target: Select contacts

segment.source: Through the Windows.ApplicationModel.Contacts namespace, you have several options for selecting contacts.
segment.target: Through the Windows.ApplicationModel.Contacts namespace, you have several options for selecting contacts.

segment.source: Here, we'll show you how to select a single contact or multiple contacts, and we'll show you how to configure the contact picker to retrieve only the contact information that your app needs.
segment.target: Here, we'll show you how to select a single contact or multiple contacts, and we'll show you how to configure the contact picker to retrieve only the contact information that your app needs.

segment.source: Send email
segment.target: Send email

segment.source: Shows how to launch the compose email dialog to allow the user to send an email message.
segment.target: Shows how to launch the compose email dialog to allow the user to send an email message.

segment.source: You can pre-populate the fields of the email with data before showing the dialog.
segment.target: You can pre-populate the fields of the email with data before showing the dialog.

segment.source: The message will not be sent until the user taps the send button.
segment.target: The message will not be sent until the user taps the send button.

segment.source: Send an SMS message
segment.target: Send an SMS message

segment.source: This topic shows you how to launch the compose SMS dialog to allow the user to send an SMS message.
segment.target: This topic shows you how to launch the compose SMS dialog to allow the user to send an SMS message.

segment.source: You can pre-populate the fields of the SMS with data before showing the dialog.
segment.target: You can pre-populate the fields of the SMS with data before showing the dialog.

segment.source: The message will not be sent until the user taps the send button.
segment.target: The message will not be sent until the user taps the send button.

segment.source: Manage appointments
segment.target: Manage appointments

segment.source: Through the Windows.ApplicationModel.Appointments namespace, you can create and manage appointments in a user's calendar app.
segment.target: Through the Windows.ApplicationModel.Appointments namespace, you can create and manage appointments in a user's calendar app.

segment.source: Here, we'll show you how to create an appointment, add it to a calendar app, replace it in the calendar app, and remove it from the calendar app.
segment.target: Here, we'll show you how to create an appointment, add it to a calendar app, replace it in the calendar app, and remove it from the calendar app.

segment.source: We'll also show how to display a time span for a calendar app and create an appointment-recurrence object.
segment.target: We'll also show how to display a time span for a calendar app and create an appointment-recurrence object.

segment.target: Related topics
